title: HTML
description: HTML is the core mark‑up language used for building web pages.

title: CSS
description: CSS is used to style and layout web pages with fonts, colors, and spacing.

title: JavaScript
description: JavaScript is the scripting language of the web, enabling interactivity and logic.

title: TypeScript
description: TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds strong typing.

title: Angular
description: Angular is a TypeScript‑based framework for building scalable web applications.

title: React
description: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, developed by Facebook.

title: Express.js
description: Express.js is a lightweight web application framework for Node.js.

title: NestJS
description: NestJS is a progressive Node.js framework for building efficient server‑side applications.

title: Java
description: Java is a high‑level, class‑based programming language used in backend and enterprise apps.

title: Spring Boot
description: Spring Boot is a Java‑based framework used to create stand‑alone, production‑grade applications.

title: DevOps
description: DevOps is a set of practices that bridges software development and IT operations.

title: Docker
description: Docker is a platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers.

title: Kubernetes
description: Kubernetes is a container orchestration system for automating deployment and scaling.

title: CI/CD
description: CI/CD is a method to frequently deliver apps by introducing automation into development and deployment.

title: PostgreSQL
description: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open‑source relational database system.

title: MongoDB
description: MongoDB is a NoSQL document database known for high performance and scalability.

title: GraphQL
description: GraphQL is a query language for APIs and a runtime for fulfilling those queries with your existing data.

title: Next.js
description: Next.js is a React framework for building full‑stack applications with SSR and API routes.

title: Redux
description: Redux is a predictable state container for JavaScript apps, often used with React.

title: REST APIs
description: REST APIs are a standard way to expose backend services over HTTP using resource‑based URIs.

title: Python
description: Python is a versatile, high‑level language used in web development, scripting, data science, and more.

title: AI Fundamentals
description: Basics of artificial intelligence including search, planning, and knowledge representation.

title: Machine Learning
description: Machine learning concepts such as supervised/unsupervised learning, model evaluation, and pipelines.

title: Git
description: Git is a version control system for tracking changes in source code during development.

title: Jira
description: Jira is a tool for project tracking, issue management, and agile team collaboration.

title: Jenkins
description: Jenkins is an automation server used to build, test, and deploy applications continuously.

title: Software Testing
description: Principles of testing including unit, integration, system, and automated testing.

title: Automation Testing (Selenium)
description: Automating browser actions for testing web apps using Selenium.

title: Android Development (Kotlin/Java)
description: Building Android applications using Kotlin or Java.

title: iOS Development (Swift)
description: Building iOS applications using Swift.

title: Cloud Basics (AWS/GCP/Azure)
description: Fundamentals of cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, and Azure.
